title: Quinta de Soalheiro 2014 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
description: This is a delicious refreshing wine with great acidity coupled with ripe white and yellow fruits. The richness is cut by minerality, fragrant acidity and lemon curd. It is still young and will be better from 2016.

title: Pianetta 2013 Bilancio Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)
description: A dusty, cigar-smoke character on the nose of this blend of 52% Syrah and 48% Cabernet Sauvignon spices up aromas of strawberry fruit and rotting roses. The palate combines complex cranberry fruits with Kalamata olive, thyme and pencil lead.

title: Vicente Gandia 2010 Raiza Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of raspberry and plum are familiar for Rioja. This feels fresh but also full and meaty. Balsamic raspberry and plum flavors finish warm, with chocolaty notes and a sense of competence and quality.

title: Testarossa 2013 Cuvee Los Gatos Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Broad aromas of seared lemons, white peach and nectarine are given nuance with a bit of quinine on this entry-level bottling. Stewed lemons and apple-custard flavors show on the plush and pillowy palate, cut with an acidic sizzle.

title: Trenel Fils 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: Soft and creamy, this full, rich wine brings together delicious yellow and white fruits with citrus acidity and a tight, nervy texture. It has an attractive perfumed character balanced with a crisp, tight aftertaste. Drink from 2016.

title: Lété-Vautrain NV Rosé Royal Brut  (Champagne)
description: Pale orange-pink in color, this is a crisp, tight and mineral-textured wine. It is fresh in the bottle, with red currant and grapefruit flavors. This fruity bottling could be held until mid-2016 to fill out the texture.

title: Fratelli Seghesio 2011 La Villa  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of stewed fruit, prune and toast lead the nose. The firm palate is still rather closed but reveals dried black cherry, fig, black pepper, clove and coffee alongside astringent, grainy tannins.

title: Gianni Gagliardo 2011 Serre  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of oak, toast, espresso and coconut carry over to palate along with coffee, a hint of baked plum and a confectionary note. Drying tannins leave an astringent finish.

title: Heinz Eifel 2014 Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Exotic, warming spices like turmeric, saffron and coriander seem to accent this sweet-savory Riesling. The palate is citrusy and bright, calibrating sunny tangerines and orange peels against a backdrop of stark lemony acidity. The finish is brisk and clean.

title: Inception 2012 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Heady notes of gingerbread and molasses mix with concentrated pomegranate, raspberry and slate on this pleasant nose. The palate tightens around iron and graphite with a dense hibiscus and pomegranate fruit character.

title: K5 Argiñano 2014 Uhin Berdea Hondarrabi Zuri (Getariako Txakolina)
description: Apple and peach aromas are clean and pure. This feels round yet compact, with orange, nectarine and pithy flavors. Green-apple tartness and malic acidity push a pure finish that doesn't balk.

title: Twomey 2013 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This easy-to-enjoy wine from the family of Silver Oak has lots of vanilla and fruit flavors and a broad but soft mouthfeel. Hints of cinnamon and red cherries come out on the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Terra Silvestre 2014 Bátoreus Selection Red (Tejo)
description: This is a rich wine dominated by ripe Alicante Bouschet that gives some firm tannins as well as juicy red berry fruits. It is ripe, well balanced and likely to age well over the next few years. Drink from 2017.

title: Château Saint-Didier-Parnac 2014 Prieuré de Cénac Mission Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: Bright and fruity, this accessible wine is ready to drink. Fresh and packed with red berries, it is juicy and fresh. The aftertaste, with its acidity, has a touch of spice. Drink now.

title: Clos La Chance 2013 Erwin Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Notes of cinnamon and peppercorns adds complexity to the cranberry-pomegranate fruit and slate minerality on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's more reserved in its palate, which offers cranberry tang with an herbal sagebrush quality, proving a reliable, straightforward take on the grape.

title: Comm. G. B. Burlotto 2013  Barbera d'Alba
description: Fresh and savory, this opens with aromas of dark berry, ground cooking spice and whiff of chopped herb. The vibrant palate doles out juicy black cherry, clove, star anise and blood orange accompanied by racy acidity.

title: Covila 2008 II Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe, loamy raisin and kirsch aromas set up a pinched clampy tannic palate that grabs like Velcro. This tastes of vanilla and creamy oak along with herbal red berry fruits. Resiny, vanilla-driven flavors crowd out residual berry fruit on the finish. Drink now.

title: Curto Marco 2011 Arborina La Foia  (Barolo)
description: This opens with rather funky aromas of scorched earth, overripe black-skinned fruit and a whiff of barnyard. The extracted palate offers mature black cherry, toast, espresso and a gamey note alongside tightly packed tannins. A note of roasted coffee bean signals the close.

title: Cascina del Monastero 2011 Perno  (Barolo)
description: This offers aromas of mature dark fruit, cured meat, cooking spice and tobacco. The extracted palate has dried black cherry, tobacco, anise and powdered sage alongside grainy tannins.

title: Della 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is tightly wound yet intense, ripe and tart in cherry, rose and lush earth. Baking spices make their way through the density of fruit, while the texture struggles to find balance. Let this powerfully built wine open in the glass.

title: Demarie 2011 Riserva  (Roero)
description: This medium-bodied red opens with aromas of toasted oak, mature berry and freshly brewed coffee. The tight palate offers dried black cherry, white pepper, espresso, and a hint of licorice framed in fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Château Eugénie 2013 Tradition Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: Like most Tradition wines in Cahors, this fruity and perfumed wine has been aged in stainless steel to keep the fruitiness. Blackberry flavors are cut with acidity and a tight tannic character. It needs to age another few months, so drink from late 2016.

title: Vinum 2014 V Series Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: One of the more reliable, big-production brands in the market right now, this wine shows fresh white flowers, with just a dollop of vanilla butter and a touch of wet stone on the nose. There is decent verve to the evenly presented and light palate, with flavors of cooked apples and sea salt.

title: Vite Colte 2013 Croere  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore)
description: Aromas of plum, pressed violet, toasted oak and a whiff of exotic spice lead the nose. The palate offers dried black cherry, raisin, licorice, espresso and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Von Der Leyen 2013 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)
description: Swirls of honeysuckle lend a delicate sweetness to this silky, off-dry Gewürztraminer. It's honeyed and plush in peach and apricot flavor, but zesty lime acidity lends a stately appeal. Drink now.

title: Von Holt 2014 Terra Alta Vineyard Viognier (Clements Hills)
description: Fresh pear, white peach and fig aromas, a rich texture, and generous vanilla and layered almond flavors describe this tasty wine that stays fresh and fruity through the finish. It offers a medium body and nice balance.

title: Adega de Cantanhede 2010 Marquês de Marialva Baga (Bairrada)
description: After five years, the Baga is beginning to soften to create a structured while generously fruity wine. It has acidity and a solid tannic base which is topped by black currant and berry fruits and followed by a richly juicy aftertaste. The crisp, crunchy aftertaste is typical of the grape as it matures. Drink now and until 2022.

title: Anaba 2013 Turbine White White (Sonoma Valley)
description: Briny, thick and gravelly, this is a blend of 42% Roussanne, 20% Grenache Blanc, 20% Picpoul Blanc and 18% Marsanne, fermented half in neutral French oak and half in stainless steel. High-toned acidity and citrus wrap around salty, herbal undertones, finishing crisp and light.

title: Baron-Fuenté NV Esprit Brut  (Champagne)
description: This ripe, rounded and fruity wine hails from vineyards at the western end of the Marne Valley. Its yellow fruit and soft apple flavors are only lightly marked by minerality. The acidity is fragrant, refreshing and with just the right crispness to balance all this soft fruit.

title: Bianchi 2013 El Camino Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Ripe yellow apples and yellow pears meet with a tropical sense of guava and tuberose on this bottling from a vineyard near the intersection of Highways 101 and 154. The flavors are more tart, with green-apple flesh, light pear and a much more reserved touch of tropical fruit and flower.
